item.title: Apple finally launches next-gen ‘CarPlay Ultra’ software, starting with Aston Martin
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Apple’s next-generation version of its popular CarPlay infotainment software is finally launching three years after it was first announced. The company said Thursday that this new version of CarPlay — now known as “CarPlay Ultra” — will start rolling out on new Aston Martin vehicles in the U.S. and Canada, roughly half a year late. […]

item.title: Sprinter Health raises $55M to expand its at-home healthcare service
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The Series B was led by General Catalyst, with Andreessen Horowitz, Regents of the University of California, Google Ventures, and Accel also investing.

item.title: Doji raises $14M to make virtual try-ons fun through AI avatars
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: For years, big tech companies like Amazon and Google have been trying to make virtual try-ons engaging to encourage consumers to shop more online. Startups also tried to solve for inspiration and fit in fashion using AI. A new startup called Doji is now entering this space with an app designed to make apparel try-ons […]

item.title: Acorns acquires family wealth and digital memory platform EarlyBird
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Savings and investing startup Acorns has acquired EarlyBird, an investment gifting platform for families, the company told TechCrunch exclusively. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed. As part of the acquisition, EarlyBird will shut down, and all customer accounts will officially close on June 23. Customers’ funds will be returned to the bank […]

item.title: Roblox now lets creators sell physical products within their experiences
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Roblox announced on Thursday that creators can now sell physical merchandise directly within their experiences and games on the platform with the launch of new Commerce APIs. The offering provides creators with a new way to generate revenue beyond the purchases of virtual goods or one-time fees to access specific experiences. The company first began […]

item.title: Coinbase says customers’ personal information stolen in data breach
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The crypto exchange giant said the hacker bribed contractors and employees in support roles to steal data.

item.title: Trump tells Apple’s CEO to stop expanding iPhone production in India
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Speaking during a business summit in Doha, Trump said he met with Cook and asked him to stop building in India and instead increase production in the US.

item.title: South Korea delays decision on letting Google move hi-res map data overseas
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: South Korea has once again postponed a decision on whether to approve Google’s request to transfer high-precision map data on the country’s geography to its international servers. In February, Google had requested approval from the Korean National Geographic Information Institute to deploy a 1:5,000 scale map on its app in the country and also transfer […]

item.title: Hedra, the app used to make talking baby podcasts, raises $32M from a16z
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Hedra, which offers a video generation and editing suite powered by its Character-3 model, has raised $32M.

item.title: Harvey reportedly in discussions to raise $250M at $5B valuation
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer, Ivan Mehta
item.description: Harvey AI is in discussions to raise more than $250 million in a funding round led by Kleiner Perkins and Coatue that would value it at $5 billion, Reuters reported

item.title: Billionaire founder of Luminar replaced as CEO following ethics inquiry
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Austin Russell, who became a billionaire after his lidar startup Luminar went public, appears to be out as CEO, according to the company’s board. Luminar’s board announced Wednesday — the same day of its first-quarter earnings report — it had replaced Russell and appointed Paul Ricci to the role. Ricci is the former chairman and […]

item.title: YouTube introduces an interactive product feed for shoppable TV ads
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: YouTube made its pitch to advertisers on Wednesday, accompanied by a flashy performance from Lady Gaga and special appearances from popular YouTubers like Brittany Broski and MrBeast.  During its Upfront presentation, YouTube executives introduced new ad formats coming to the platform, including an enhanced shoppable connected TV (CTV) offering that includes a new interactive product […]

item.title: YouTube targets TV dollars with NFL deal, bingeable ‘shows’ from creators
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: YouTube announced a range of initiatives designed to attract more TV ad dollars to its platform at Brandcast, its annual Upfront event for advertisers. Notably, the Google-owned video service is expanding its relationship with the NFL and plans to exclusively stream the NFL’s first Friday game of the 2025-2026 season. It’s also preparing to pilot […]

item.title: YouTube viewers will start seeing ads after ‘peak’ moments in videos
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Imagine you’re watching a highly anticipated video from your favorite YouTube creator — perhaps the moment a famous couple finally gets engaged — when an ad pops up immediately after the clip. This is part of YouTube’s new ad format called “Peak Points.” The company revealed the new ad format during its Upfront presentation on […]

item.title: The latest Apple Maps update will bring out your bougie side
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Apple Maps announced a collaboration with the MICHELIN Guide, The Infatuation, and Golf Digest to help users find recommended restaurants and golf courses in their area. Starting in the U.S., users will be able to filter their Maps searches to see restaurants with MICHELIN ratings, which denote exceptional dining experiences. But if you’re on the […]

item.title: Netflix adds more live TV to its lineup
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Netflix is adding more livestreaming content, the company announced at its Upfront presentation on Wednesday. The service, which now reaches over 94 million global monthly active users, has been steadily introducing live TV to its audience with sports content from WWE wrestling, comedy, and awards shows, and other special events (some of which definitely didn’t […]

item.title: Waymo recalls 1,200 robotaxis following low-speed collisions with gates and chains
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Waymo issued a software recall on 1,200 self-driving vehicles after some of its robotaxis were involved in minor collisions with gates, chains, and other gate-like roadway objects. The software update, which was first reported by Reuters, was conducted late last year, according to documents filed with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). The Alphabet-owned […]

item.title: Grok is unpromptedly telling X users about South African ‘white genocide’
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok appeared to experience a bug on Wednesday that caused it to reply to dozens of posts on X with information about “white genocide” in South Africa, even when the user didn’t ask anything about the subject. The strange responses stem from the X account for Grok, which replies to users […]

item.title: Foxconn gets nod for $435M project to make more of Apple chips in India, eventually
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Foxconn, a key manufacturer for Apple, has received an approval from India’s cabinet to build a new 37 billion Indian rupees ($435 million) semiconductor plant in a joint venture with the country’s IT giant HCL Group. The deal is the latest move to reduce Apple’s reliance on China and produce more components in India. The […]

item.title: The Kids Online Safety Act is back, with the potential to change the internet
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA) has been reintroduced into Congress. If passed into law, this bill could impose some of the most significant legislative changes that the internet has seen in the U.S. since the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) of 1998. As it currently stands, KOSA would be able to hold social […]
